L o r e m I p s u m d o l o r V i v a m u s s i t a m e t d o l o r s i t a m e t n u n c m a x i m u s f i n i b u s . D o n e c v e l o r n a r e l e o , e g e t g r a v i d a o r c i . E t i a m v i t a e r u t r u m n i s i . M a u r i s a u c t o r v e l i t e t u l t r i c i e s m o l l i s . D o n e c i n m a t t i s l e c t u s . I n h a c h a b i t a s s e p l a t e a d i c t u m s t . S e d u l t r i c i e s m a g n a u t l i g u l a f r i n g i l l a f a c i l i s i s . U t s o d a l e s e r a t u t l i b e r o r h o n c u s h e n d r e r i t . V i v a m u s n u n c m a g n a , f i n i b u s v e l v e l i t i n , t e m p u s v e n e n a t i s d o l o r . A e n e a n a l e o n o n t e l l u s s e m p e r u l t r i c i e s e g e t q u i s e n i m .

L o c a l e S e t t i n g s Y o u a r e a b l e t o s e t y o u r p r e f e r r e d l o c a l i z a t i o n s e t t i n g s a n d h o w y o u w a n t y o u r s i t e t o b e h a v e i n c a s e w h e r e y o u h a v e a v i s i t o r f r o m s o m e p a r t i c u l a r l o c a l e . & n b s p ; D e f a u l t L o c a l e - S e t s t h e d e f a u l t l o c a l e w h i c h d e t e r m i n e s & n b s p ; d a t e a n d t i m e f o r m a t t i n g , & n b s p ; d e c i m a l s e p a r a t o r a n d s y s t e m r e s p o n s e s . L o c a l e O p t i o n s - C h o o s e w h e t h e r t o & n b s p ; A u t o T r a n s l a t e O u t p u t T e x t - C h o o s e w h e t h e r t o t r a n s l a t e o u t p u t t e x t S a v e n e w w o r d s - c h o o s e t o s a v e n e w w o r d s w h i c h a r e n o t c u r r e n t l y t r a n s l a t e d i n t o a n y l o c a l l a n g u a g e A u t o - D e t e c t L o c a l e - A u t o - d e t e c t l o c a l e t h r o u g h u s e r b r o w s e r . V i e w o r S e t L o c a l e S e t t i n g s T r a n s l a t i o n Y o u a r e a b l e t o t r a n s l a t e y o u r s i t e & n b s p ; i n t o a n y o t h e r l a n g u a g e o f c h o i c e . {"editable":"

 

Localization

 

Localization of PageCarton refers to the adaptation of web content to meet the language, cultural and other requirements of a specific target market. PageCarton has been made to support internationalization and so, it is ready to be localized into any such language which its users may want.

 

Locale Settings

You are able to set your preferred localization settings and how you want your site to behave in case where you have a visitor from some particular locale. 

  • Default Locale - Sets the default locale which determines date and time formatting, decimal separator and system responses.
  • Locale Options - Choose whether to 
     
    • Auto Translate Output Text - Choose whether to translate output text
    • Save new words - choose to save new words which are not currently translated into any local language
    • Auto-Detect Locale - Auto-detect locale through user browser.

View or Set Locale Settings

 

Translation

 

You are able to translate your site into any other language of choice. Here are the few steps to achieve this

 

  1. Add new language locale to the Locale List on your site. 
     
    • Locale Name - would be the \"English\" name of the language to be added. e.g. Russian
    • Native Name - would be the local way of spelling the name of the language e.g. native name of \"Russian\" is \"Русский\", and the native name of \"Yoruba\" is \"Yorùbá\"
    • Locale Code - The internationalized locale code for the language being added. e.g. Russian is \"ru_RU\" and Yoruba is \"yor\"

      Add new Locale Manage Locale List
       
  2. Put the right Settings up

    In the PageCarton Locale Settings, set Locale Options to \"Save new words\", and \"Auto Translate Output Text\".  This is to allow PageCarton to pick up words and get them ready to translation into the languages set in the Locale List. We wouldn't want to be inputing the words one by one, especially for sites loaded with a lot of words already. 

    View or Set Locale Settings

  3. Auto populate words 

    Normally, all the site pages need to be previewed so that new words may be detected and added to the translation library. But then, to simply the process, PageCarton now has a widget that call all the pages and widgets automatically in other to invoke the right words into the words translation database. This is now as simple has just clicking a button

    Populate Words
     
  4.

        Localization

         

        Localization of PageCarton refers to the adaptation of web content to meet the language, cultural and other requirements of a specific target market. PageCarton has been made to support internationalization and so, it is ready to be localized into any such language which its users may want.

        Locale Settings

        You are able to set your preferred localization settings and how you want your site to behave in case where you have a visitor from some particular locale. 

        • Default Locale - Sets the default locale which determines date and time formatting, decimal separator and system responses.
        • Locale Options - Choose whether to 

          • Auto Translate Output Text - Choose whether to translate output text
          • Save new words - choose to save new words which are not currently translated into any local language
          • Auto-Detect Locale - Auto-detect locale through user browser.

        View or Set Locale Settings

        Translation

        You are able to translate your site into any other language of choice. Here are the few steps to achieve this

H e r e a r e t h e f e w s t e p s t o a c h i e v e t h i s & n b s p ;","viewableobject_id":"16","class_name":"Ayoola_Page_Editor_Text","object_name":"pageEditText","view_parameters":"HTML Text","module":null,"advanced_parameters":"pagewidget_id=1563706806-0-4"},"1563713455":{"editable":"

           

          Localization

           

          Localization of PageCarton refers to the adaptation of web content to meet the language, cultural and other requirements of a specific target market. PageCarton has been made to support internationalization and so, it is ready to be localized into any such language which its users may want.

           

          Locale Settings

          You are able to set your preferred localization settings and how you want your site to behave in case where you have a visitor from some particular locale. 

          • Default Locale - Sets the default locale which determines date and time formatting, decimal separator and system responses.
          • Locale Options - Choose whether to 
             
            • Auto Translate Output Text - Choose whether to translate output text
            • Save new words - choose to save new words which are not currently translated into any local language
            • Auto-Detect Locale - Auto-detect locale through user browser.

          View or Set Locale Settings

           

          Translation

           

          You are able to translate your site into any other language of choice. Here are the few steps to achieve this

           

          1. Add new language locale to the Locale List on your site. 
             
            • Locale Name - would be the \"English\" name of the language to be added. e.g. Russian
            • Native Name - would be the local way of spelling the name of the language e.g. native name of \"Russian\" is \"Русский\", and the native name of \"Yoruba\" is \"Yorùbá\"
            • Locale Code - The internationalized locale code for the language being added. e.g. Russian is \"ru_RU\" and Yoruba is \"yor\"

              Add new Locale Manage Locale List
               
          2. Put the right Settings up

            In the PageCarton Locale Settings, set Locale Options to \"Save new words\", and \"Auto Translate Output Text\".  This is to allow PageCarton to pick up words and get them ready to translation into the languages set in the Locale List. We wouldn't want to be inputing the words one by one, especially for sites loaded with a lot of words already. 

            View or Set Locale Settings

          3. Auto populate words 

            Normally, all the site pages need to be previewed so that new words may be detected and added to the translation library. But then, to simply the process, PageCarton now has a widget that call all the pages and widgets automatically in other to invoke the right words into the words translation database. This is now as simple has just clicking a button

            Populate Words
             
          4.  

           

          ","preserved_content":"

          • Default Locale - Sets the default locale which determines date and time formatting, decimal separator and system responses.
          • Locale Options - Choose whether to 

            • Auto Translate Output Text - Choose whether to translate output text
            • Save new words - choose to save new words which are not currently translated into any local language
            • Auto-Detect Locale - Auto-detect locale through user browser.

          View or Set Locale Settings

          You are able to translate your site into any other language of choice. Here are the few steps to achieve this

            Localization

             

            Localization of PageCarton refers to the adaptation of web content to meet the language, cultural and other requirements of a specific target market. PageCarton has been made to support internationalization and so, it is ready to be localized into any such language which its users may want.

             

            Locale Settings

            You are able to set your preferred localization settings and how you want your site to behave in case where you have a visitor from some particular locale. 

            • Default Locale - Sets the default locale which determines date and time formatting, decimal separator and system responses.
            • Locale Options - Choose whether to 
               
              • Auto Translate Output Text - Choose whether to translate output text
              • Save new words - choose to save new words which are not currently translated into any local language
              • Auto-Detect Locale - Auto-detect locale through user browser.

            View or Set Locale Settings

             

            Translation

             

            You are able to translate your site into any other language of choice. Here are the few steps to achieve this

             

            1. Add new language locale to the Locale List on your site. 
               
              • Locale Name - would be the \"English\" name of the language to be added. e.g. Russian
              • Native Name - would be the local way of spelling the name of the language e.g. native name of \"Russian\" is \"Русский\", and the native name of \"Yoruba\" is \"Yorùbá\"
              • Locale Code - The internationalized locale code for the language being added. e.g. Russian is \"ru_RU\" and Yoruba is \"yor\"

                Add new Locale Manage Locale List
                 
            2. Put the right Settings up

              In the PageCarton Locale Settings, set Locale Options to \"Save new words\", and \"Auto Translate Output Text\".  This is to allow PageCarton to pick up words and get them ready to translation into the languages set in the Locale List. We wouldn't want to be inputing the words one by one, especially for sites loaded with a lot of words already. 

              View or Set Locale Settings

            3. Auto populate words 

              Normally, all the site pages need to be previewed so that new words may be detected and added to the translation library. But then, to simply the process, PageCarton now has a widget that call all the pages and widgets automatically in other to invoke the right words into the words translation database. This is now as simple has just clicking a button

              Populate Words
               
            4.
